title.narrative: GFDRR South-South Cooperation Program Grant for Facilitating Women's Leadership & Forging Partnerships to Drive the Demand for Lo

description.narrative: The overarching goal of the project is the Facilitation of Women's Leadership and Forging Partnerships to Drive the Demand for Local Implementation of the Hyogo Framework for Action (HFA). The aim is to bring together policy makers and practitioners from 2 disaster-prone regions (South Asia and Central America) and 3 countries (India, Guatemala, and Honduras) with large sections of vulnerable communities with the objective of experience sharing and information exchange on community led DRR practices with community based women groups and local government (CBWG&LG) to integrate DRR perspectives into mainstream disaster risk management (DRM).This goal will be achieved through two interlinked objectives: Objective 1: Positioning Grassroots Women's Groups as builders of Community Resilience Helping them to engage in effective partnerships with local governments and national governments to innovate and scale up locally led DRR initiatives. This in turn will drive the demand for development and poverty reduction programming that places disaster risk and vulnerability reduction at the center of development plans and programs at local, national and regional levels. Objective 2: Local implementation of the Hyogo Framework for Action (HFA) Implementation will be ensured by fostering collaborative local partnerships that practically reduce the vulnerability of poor families to the devastating impacts of disaster and climate change in high risk areas.
